clinical_study.brief_title: Magnesium and Rotational Thromboelastometry (ROTEM) in Colorectal Cancer Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Magnesium sulphate is given to the patients during the colorectal cancer surgery under the hypothesis that it would attenuate the postoperative hypercoagulability. The investigators intend to characterize the changes of coagulation in colorectal cancer patients by using the point-of-care device after the infusion of magnesium sulphate.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patients undergoing a laparoscopic colorectal cancer surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Renal disease
- Hepatic disease
- Neuromuscular disease
- Coagulation disorder
- Cardiopulmonary disease
